channel.title: Boardgames on Pandaqi Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Boardgames on Pandaqi Blog

item.title: The Game of Dilemmas
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for The Game of Dilemmas. This will be an incredibly short devlog, because this game was basically born while making The Game of Happiness.

item.title: The Game of Happiness
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for The Game of Happiness. This is a really weird, special, personal project. The devlog will probably be quite short and the game not as expansive / marketed / polished as my others.

item.title: Firecrackers
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for Firecrackers. In this article I’ll (briefly) explain the process behind developing this game, the problems I faced and how I solved them, and hopefully more interesting stuff.

item.title: Sleighwell
item.description: Welcome to another devlog, for another holiday-themed game, and this time it’s Sleighwell. (The initial name was Reindeer Road and then Reindeer River, but those names were already claimed by pretty big things!

item.title: Mountain Miners
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for Mountain Miners. In this article, I’ll briefly explain the development process behind this game.

item.title: Pumpkin Patrol
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for Pumpkin Patrol. This one will be MUCH shorter (and a bit different) than the usual devlogs.

item.title: Feed the Beast
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my game Feed the Beast! In this article, I keep track of the entire process from start to finish, talking about interesting problems and how I solved them, and anything else that’s relevant.

item.title: Hold my Bear!
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my game Hold my Bear!. In this article, I’ll briefly discuss how I made the game, the challenges along the way, how I solved those, and hopefully some interesting lessons or stories from development.

item.title: Meadowmight
item.description: Welcome to the devlog (“developer diary”) for my game Meadowmight. I’ll explain the process of making the game, the problems and how I solved them, and any other interesting steps in between.

item.title: Split the Foody
item.description: Welcome to the devlog (“developer diary”) for my game Split the Foody I will explain my thought process, problems and how I solved them, and any other interesting bits along the path to creating this game!

item.title: Slippery Slopes
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my game Slippery Slopes. In this article, I’ll briefly discuss how I made the game, the challenges along the way, how I solved those, and hopefully some interesting lessons or stories from development.

item.title: Mammoth Messages
item.description: Welcome to another devlog, this time for my simple party game Mammoth Messages. In this brief article I will explain the original idea, how I executed it, any problems or interesting stuff I encountered along the way, and hopefully some of it is interesting or fun to read.

item.title: Kangaruse
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my game Kangaruse. I’ll (briefly) explain the design process for the game. Where did the idea come from?

item.title: Photomone: Antsassins
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Photomone: Antsassins. As expected, it’s part of the Photomone Games project.

item.title: Photomone: Digital Antists
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Photomone: Digital Antists. As expected, it’s part of the Photomone Games project.

item.title: Photomone
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Photomone. It’s a simple (party?) game I wanted to make for a while, but I could never quite figure out the details.

item.title: Keebble: Domino
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Keebble Domino. As expected, it’s a part of the Keebble Games project.

item.title: Keebble: Knickknack
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Keebble Knickknack. As expected, it’s part of the Keebble Games project.

item.title: That's Amorphe: Pictures
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game That’s Amorphe: Pictures. As expected, it’s a variant (or spin-off, or expansion, or sequel) for That’s Amorphe.

item.title: That's Amorphe
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my party game That’s Amorphe!. In this article, I’ll explain where the idea came from, how I developed it, and anything else that might be funny or educational.

item.title: Keebble
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my word-based party game Keebble This is a short article about the creation process: what problems I faced, how I solved them, and other interesting tidbits I wanted to share.
